Detailed Description

This class provides the plasma profile which can be set by set of points or parameterized by CPfunction().

F(x) =n0[g-h+(1-g+h)(1-xp)q + h(1-e-x2/w2)], where 0<=x<=1,

properties: g=F(1)/F(0), F(0) = 1, F(x)>0,
usage:
  CProfile ne;
  // n0 is the value in the center
  // parm is the array[5] with coefficients: g,p,q,h,w.
  ne.set(n0,parm);
  double n = ne(x);
Examples:

cpp2for.cpp, and raytrace2.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

void set ( double  v0,
double *  param,
double  c = 0 
)

The method sets parameters for analitic representation of the profile function.

F(x) = c[g-h+(1-g+h)(1-xp)q + h(1-e-x2/w2)], where 0<=x<=1,

Parameters:
v0 is the value in the center
param is the array[5] of coefficients: g,p,q,h,w.
c is the center of the hole.

Definition at line 118 of file CPfunction.h.

void set ( const double *  x,
const double *  p,
int  n 
)

The method sets points of the profile function from arrays.

For evaluating the function in intermediate points linear interpolation is used, see interpolate()

Parameters:
x is the abscissa points, array of size n, 0<=x<=1 (dimentionless flux label)
p is the ordinate set, array of size n.
n is the size of arrays.

Definition at line 128 of file CPfunction.h.

void set ( const double *  r,
const double *  p,
double  rmax,
int  n 
)

The method sets points of the profile function from arrays.

For evaluating the function in intermediate points linear interpolation is used, see interpolate()

Parameters:
r is the abscissa points, array of size n, 0<=r<=rmax
p is the ordinate set, array of size n.
rmax is the max value of abscissa, can be larger than last r, internally r is normalized by rmax
n is the size of arrays.
